intro: Isnardia polycarpa, commonly known as the many-fruited isnardia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and smooth, elliptical leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that ripens to a yellowish color.
